Class Decryption

  • java.lang.Object
    • Decryption

  • public class Decryption
extends java.lang.Object
    This class consists of decryption algorithms and methods which can be used to decrypt files and folders
    Author:
    Tamir Arie

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  Decryption.workerThread

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void caesarAlgo(boolean split)
      The Caesar Algorithm used to decrypt file it print it's name and then start record time for decryption initialize the files required to read and to write to getting the keys for that algorithm (if split equals true - add the next key that in keys) check that the keys are correct and cannot cause data loss and then read the file byte by byte and encrypting it after that set the end time to measure time it took to decrypt
      void chooseMethod(java.util.LinkedList<java.lang.Integer> set, boolean split)
      The chooseMethod function used to handle set of actions it pops the next action that need to done at the given set and handle it in switch case in case of choose=5 it creates encryption object and sending it the current file that need to be decrypted and if wer'e decrypting it in folder and sending booleans that indicate 1.false -that wer'e not encrypting (wer'e currently calling it from decryption) 2.false -that wer'e not in sync (not relevant because wer'e handling one file here) 3.true - that we have the set for the required operation (the set that wer'e using here)
      void doubleAlgo(java.util.LinkedList<java.lang.Integer> set, boolean split)
      The Double Algorithm used to decrypt one file it print it's name and then start record time for decryption calling the chooseMethod function twice and if split equals true increment the numOfDec for that (that we will read the next keys) after that set the end time to measure time it took to decrypt
      void multiplicationAlgo(boolean split)
      The Multiplication Algorithm used to decrypt file it print it's name and then start record time for decryption initialize the files required to read and to write to getting the keys for that algorithm (if split equals true - add the next key that in keys) check that the keys are correct and cannot cause data loss and then read the file byte by byte and decrypting it after that set the end time to measure time it took to decrypt
      void reverseAlgo(java.util.LinkedList<java.lang.Integer> set, boolean split)
      The Reverse Algorithm used to decrypt one file it print it's name it pops the next action that need to done at the given set and handle it in switch case it setting the keys of the encryption object to the keys that been generated here so it uses them and calls the method in encryption
      void xorAlgo(boolean split)
      The Xor Algorithm used to decrypt file it print it's name and then start record time for decryption initialize the files required to read and to write to getting the keys for that algorithm (if split equals true - add the next key that in keys) check that the keys are correct and cannot cause data loss and then read the file byte by byte and encrypting it after that set the end time to measure time it took to decrypt

    • Constructor Detail

      • Decryption

        public Decryption(java.lang.String name,
                  boolean encFolder,
                  boolean isDecrypting,
                  boolean sync,
                  boolean hasSet)
           throws java.io.IOException
        This constructor initialize the arguments required for decryption, and checks what should be executed:
        Parameters:
        name - the name of file/folder to be decrypted
        encFolder - decrypt file or a folder,
        sync - decrypt them in sync method or async
        isDecrypting - check if it needs to be encrypted or decrypted
        hasSet - check if someone wants to supply the Set of actions or it needs to be created
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - in case of error on reading/writing file

    • Method Detail

      • multiplicationAlgo

        public void multiplicationAlgo(boolean split)
                        throws java.io.IOException,
                               KeyException
        The Multiplication Algorithm used to decrypt file it print it's name and then start record time for decryption initialize the files required to read and to write to getting the keys for that algorithm (if split equals true - add the next key that in keys) check that the keys are correct and cannot cause data loss and then read the file byte by byte and decrypting it after that set the end time to measure time it took to decrypt
        Parameters:
        split - representing if we're at split algorithm
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - in case of error on reading/writing file
        KeyException - in case of invalid key that can cause data loss etc..

      • xorAlgo

        public void xorAlgo(boolean split)
             throws java.io.IOException,
                    KeyException
        The Xor Algorithm used to decrypt file it print it's name and then start record time for decryption initialize the files required to read and to write to getting the keys for that algorithm (if split equals true - add the next key that in keys) check that the keys are correct and cannot cause data loss and then read the file byte by byte and encrypting it after that set the end time to measure time it took to decrypt
        Parameters:
        split - representing if we're at split algorithm
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - in case of error on reading/writing file
        KeyException - in case of invalid key that can cause data loss etc..

      • caesarAlgo

        public void caesarAlgo(boolean split)
                throws java.io.IOException,
                       KeyException
        The Caesar Algorithm used to decrypt file it print it's name and then start record time for decryption initialize the files required to read and to write to getting the keys for that algorithm (if split equals true - add the next key that in keys) check that the keys are correct and cannot cause data loss and then read the file byte by byte and encrypting it after that set the end time to measure time it took to decrypt
        Parameters:

        Throws:

      • doubleAlgo

        public void doubleAlgo(java.util.LinkedList<java.lang.Integer> set,
                       boolean split)
                throws java.io.IOException,
                       KeyException
        The Double Algorithm used to decrypt one file it print it's name and then start record time for decryption calling the chooseMethod function twice and if split equals true increment the numOfDec for that (that we will read the next keys) after that set the end time to measure time it took to decrypt
        Parameters:
        set - representing the set of actions that remained undone
        split - representing if we're at split algorithm
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - in case of error on reading/writing file
        KeyException - in case of invalid key that can cause data loss etc..

      • reverseAlgo

        public void reverseAlgo(java.util.LinkedList<java.lang.Integer> set,
                        boolean split)
                 throws java.io.IOException,
                        KeyException
        The Reverse Algorithm used to decrypt one file it print it's name it pops the next action that need to done at the given set and handle it in switch case it setting the keys of the encryption object to the keys that been generated here so it uses them and calls the method in encryption
        Parameters:
        set - representing the set of actions that remained undone
        split - representing if we're at split algorithm
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - in case of error on reading/writing file
        KeyException - in case of invalid key that can cause data loss etc..

      • chooseMethod

        public void chooseMethod(java.util.LinkedList<java.lang.Integer> set,
                         boolean split)
                  throws java.io.IOException,
                         KeyException
        The chooseMethod function used to handle set of actions it pops the next action that need to done at the given set and handle it in switch case in case of choose=5 it creates encryption object and sending it the current file that need to be decrypted and if wer'e decrypting it in folder and sending booleans that indicate 1.false -that wer'e not encrypting (wer'e currently calling it from decryption) 2.false -that wer'e not in sync (not relevant because wer'e handling one file here) 3.true - that we have the set for the required operation (the set that wer'e using here)
        Parameters:
        set - representing the set of actions that remained undone
        split - representing if we're at split algorithm
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - in case of error on reading/writing file
        KeyException - in case of invalid key that can cause data loss etc..
